Posts.Content: I am a 73 year old woman and have recently found a breast lump in the right breast. FNAC report says that the lump has highly atypical cells and fragments suspicious for a carcinoma.Mammogram and ultrasound also have been done. The size of the lump is 1.5 in diameter. A biopsy confirmation has been recommended. In this case is it advisable to get the complete right breast removed through surgery or only the lump should be removed for further investigation?
Posts.Title: Seeking advice
